page.title: 19More Holwell Agriculture
page.content: Cows are housed in cubicles or a covered yard during winter,with straw as bedding.Cows have a 9 month gestation;some farms keep their own bull and some use the local Artificial Insemination centre.Most calves are born from August to November.Higher prices are paid for milk at this time and harvest work is finished. Farming could not be carried out today without machinery:milking machines,bulk tank refrigerators, tractors with yard scrapers,loaders and manure spreaders,mowers,foragers, trailers for silage and balers for hay and straw. Poultry for Christmas is a small industry in the area:turkeys(weighing 10_25 lb) and chickens(8_15 lb),both white feathered;also a few ducks and geese. Locally milled animal feeds are available.
